title: Law establishing the Levy on Imported Goods for Financing African Union Activities
title_en: Law establishing the Levy on Imported Goods for Financing African Union Activities

provisions.title: Article One – Purpose of this Law
provisions.content: This Law establishes a levy on imported goods for financing African Union activities.

provisions.title: Article 2 – Scope of this Law
provisions.content: This Law applies to all imported goods. It does not apply to goods exempted under relevant laws.

provisions.title: Article 3 – Definitions of terms
provisions.content: For purposes of this Law, the following terms have the following meanings: 1° levy: fees paid on imported goods intended for financing African Union activities; 2° goods: tangible or intangible property excluding money and monetary instruments.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Levy on imported goods, its collection and management
provisions.title: Article 4 – Rate and base of the levy on imported goods
provisions.content: All imported goods are subject to a levy of zero point two per cent (0.2%), to be levied on the customs value of imported goods.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Levy on imported goods, its collection and management
provisions.title: Article 5 – Levy collection
provisions.content: The levy on imported goods is collected at the customs point in accordance with the customs legislation.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Levy on imported goods, its collection and management
provisions.title: Article 6 – Levy management
provisions.content: The levy collected on imported goods is deposited into an account intended for that purpose, opened with the National Bank of Rwanda.

provisions.title: Article 7 – Drafting, consideration and adoption of this Law
provisions.content: This Law was drafted in English, considered and adopted in Kinyarwanda.

provisions.title: Article 8 – Repealing provision
provisions.content: All prior provisions contrary to this Law are repealed.

provisions.title: Article 9 – Commencement
provisions.content: This Law comes into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda.

definitions.definition: tangible or intangible property excluding money and monetary instruments
